WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
TypeScript intellisense does not work as it is like in C#.
When I see the list members in intellisense, and type ".", it can not autocomplete the match member.
And VS2012 "EDIT" menu -> intellisense -> "Toggle Completion Mode" does not work.

Comments.Message:
Hi

Following this worked for me.

http://blogs.msdn.com/b/timart/archive/2012/10/02/typescript-project-in-visual-studio-2012.aspx

Assigning to Jonathan who is managing our suggests.

Proposal here would be to allow switching to C#-style intellisense that completes from the completion list on certain characters (dot, comma, etc) other than just Tab

Typescript options are really missing Intellisense tab group http://screencast.com/t/LaMuwyfl
Please add them! It's a pain to always press enter or tab!
We need at least the same intellisense tab page there is for JavaScript language.
